questions.question: What does it mean to fund W.O.W.?

choices.answer: to provide money to pay for it

questions.question: What is the central problem the characters deal with in our story?

choices.answer: How they are going to get food.
How they are finding a place for a car wash.
Picking up things for the group

questions.question: In a play or drama, what happens after the problem is introduced?

choices.answer: The characters try to deal with or solve the problem.
The characters talk to their parents.
The characters tell all their friends about the problem.

questions.question: How are the characters trying to solve the problem?

choices.answer: They started telling all their friends.
They ask their parents to complain to the library.
They are trying to find a way to raise money to save W.O.W.
They didn't care about it so they ignored it.

questions.question: What do you think are some of Mr. Diaz's reasons for donating the use of his parking lot?

choices.answer: He care about his niece, Ileana.
Donating the parking lot helps Mrs.  Nguyen's in return.
He remembers that Mrs. Nguyen's recipe helped his business.

questions.question: What does Shane mean by "the power of W.O.W."?

choices.answer: Means that W.O.W. gives people power to do what they want.
It is a magical poser that is helping them.
The Greek Mythological Gods are helping them.

questions.question: Do you think the children deserve credit for the appearance of a TV reporter at their car wash?
Do you agree that Ileana is the organizer?  Be ready with text evidence.
What do you think will happen as a result of the interview with the TV reporter?

choices.answer: People will go somewhere else to get a car wash.
They will not get enough money.
People will learn WOW will be lost and will come and help.

questions.question: In this play, which is the more powerful publicity tool? Be ready to explain.
Why did some people send checks instead of bringing their cars to the car wash?

choices.answer: Some wanted to give more money.
Some wanted to help but had no car.
